Author: tomek
Content: Don't care about it either now. I liked it when it was simple. And before I got to know how full of himself Zuckerberg is. I could barely stand listening to him giving a talk. He talks about social graph as if it was his invention and equal in impact at least to the invention of a wheel. An old good connections representation in the context of a social network. Doesn't look like a revolution to me.

Author: nostrademons
Content:
Karma whoring! Unlike in Reddit, comments count for karma here. So having us vote up comments instead of the article still isn't karma-neutral. You'd need an additional "Vote this down when you vote up one of the other options" to have that.

But it's an interesting poll, so I'll vote up anyway.

Author: epi0Bauqu
Content: People should reply to the comments and not just upvote them so we see who is where.  Otherwise, this looks a lot like a ploy for karma.

Content: $10 CPM? That's not going to hold up very long.

Author: byrneseyeview
Content:
That, or there's Instapundit and Daily Kos.

Most popular bloggers lean towards collect stories -- they don't write them.

Blogs are a distributed newsroom: reporters and editors don't even have to know each other to outwrite and outthink the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal, and the Washington Post.
